intro: Diabelia serrata f. wenzhouensis, commonly known as the Wenzhou variant of the serrated diabelia, is a rare plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive serrated leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in mountainous regions. Its botanical features include slender stems, opposite leaf arrangement, and white to pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
